questions.question: If a deductive argument has all true premises, then it is valid.
Categorical syllogisms begin with words like "all," "none," or "some."
Ethics tries to deal with particular actions, guiding what is right and wrong.
The validity of a deductive argument can be determined by its logical structure.
An argument is a type of passage that intends to establish a conclusion through reasoning.
Which of the following are all types of arguments?

options.B: Predictions, categorical syllogisms, arguments from signs
options.C: Warnings, conditional statements, statements of belief
options.D: Expository passages, reports, pieces of advice

questions.question: Which of the following is a conclusion indicator?
Which of the following is a sufficient condition for committing a crime?
In the statement "If a nation engages in torture, then it loses moral authority in the world community," the statement "A nation engages in torture" is called the:
An argument whose conclusion rests on a similarity between two things or situations is:
